docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 23--The installation by the Bolivian armed forces of a new military president, disregarding the invalidation of his election by a national electoral court because of fraud, is a setback for President Carter's advocacy of...
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 23--The installation by the Bolivian armed forces of a new military president, disregarding the invalidation of his election by a national electoral court because of fraud, is a setback for President Carter's advocacy of democracy in Latin America.
docs.abstract: installation by Bolivian armed forces of Pereda, disregarding invalidation of his election by natl electoral ct because of fraud, is seen as setback for Pres Carter's advocacy of democracy in Latin Amer (M)

headline.main: Coup in Bolivia Poses a Challenge To U.S. as Advocate of Democracy; Challenge to Carter Administration Vote in Ecuador Considered Honest 'Cruelty and Destruction'

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, July 26--For two years after her son disappeared following  his arrest, Rosario Ibarra de Piedra trekked around Mexico visiting police chiefs, politicians and even the President in the hope that the 21-year-old medical student would be...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, July 26--For two years after her son disappeared following his arrest, Rosario Ibarra de Piedra trekked around Mexico visiting police chiefs, politicians and even the President in the hope that the 21-year-old medical student would be presented in public alive. "I don't know why, but I really had faith in our legal system," she said.
docs.abstract: Article on Rosario Ibarra de Piedra, founder of Natl Com to Defend Pol Prisoners, Fugitives, Exiles and Disappeared Persons, which is focal point of growing campaign for nationwide pol amnesty; Mrs Ibarra de Piedra's decision to form orgn with other women occurred as result of arrest and disappearance of her 21-yr-old son Jesus in Apr '75; illus (M)

headline.main: A Mother Leads Crusade in Mexico for Political Amnesty; Says Image Is False Disappearances Most Worrying 'Seemed a Quiet Boy' Blanket Amnesty Refused

byline.original: By ALAN RIDING Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 26--Gen. Juan Pereda Asbun, Bolivia's new President, said today that he would be prepared to hold new general elections in 18 months if the electoral law and registry of voters could be reformed in time.
docs.lead_paragraph: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 26--Gen. Juan Pereda Asbun, Bolivia's new President, said today that he would be prepared to hold new general elections in 18 months if the electoral law and registry of voters could be reformed in time.
docs.abstract: Pres Pereda is prepared to hold new gen election in 18 mos if electoral law and registry of voters can be reformed in time, int; says human rights policy under ex-Pres Banzer will be continued; adds new regime is eager to obtain quick recognition internationally, especially from US; he celebrates 47th birthday (M)

headline.main: Bolivian Says Elections Could Be Held in 1980 If Reforms Are Made; Recovery of Lost Territory Sought Quick Recognition Wanted

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SAN SALVADOR--After a wave of kidnappings by leftists, the wealthy businessmen and farmers in El Salvador are living in fear, many venturing out of their homes and offices only with armed bodyguards and in bulletproof cars. Some have sent their...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR--After a wave of kidnappings by leftists, the wealthy businessmen and farmers in El Salvador are living in fear, many venturing out of their homes and offices only with armed bodyguards and in bulletproof cars. Some have sent their families out of the country for safety.
docs.abstract: Wealthy businessmen and farmers are living in fear, many venturing out of their homes and offices only with armed bodyguards and in bulletproof cars in wake of wave of kidnappings by leftists; some have sent their families out of country for safety; militant labor and peasant leaders, after increase in Govt repression, are also living in fear; parallel phenomena reflect sharp pol polarization of repub; map (M)

headline.main: Fear Rules in El Salvador as Political Foes Turn Violent; Wealth in a Few Hands Foreign Businessmen Troubled 29 Deaths and 713 Arrests Listed

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3--The House narrowly rejected today an effort to ban the indirect use of foreign aid funds for Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam and Uganda after opponents had charged that such a restriction would require the United States to withdraw from...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3--The House narrowly rejected today an effort to ban the indirect use of foreign aid funds for Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam and Uganda after opponents had charged that such a restriction would require the United States to withdraw from international aid banks and other institutions.
docs.abstract: US HR, 203-198, rejects move to bar indirect use of foreign aid funds for Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos (S)

headline.main: Ban on Indirect Aid to 4 Countries Is Defeated in a Close House Vote; Human Rights Violations Cited

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Aug. 4--A Cuban, who said that he had infiltrated the Central Intelligence Agency as a "double agent" and was sent to work in Uruguay, charged today that United States police advisers routinely recommended the use of torture for interrogation...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Aug. 4--A Cuban, who said that he had infiltrated the Central Intelligence Agency as a "double agent" and was sent to work in Uruguay, charged today that United States police advisers routinely recommended the use of torture for interrogation purposes there in the early 1970's.
docs.abstract: Manuel Hevia Cosculluela, Cuban who says he infiltrated CIA as 'double agent' and was sent to Uruguay, charges in Havana that US police advisers routinely recommended use of torture for interrogation purposes; cites US official Dan A Mitrione, who was killed by Tupamaros in '70 (S)

headline.main: Cuban 'Agent' Says U.S. Police Aides Urged Torture; Not Merely Work of an Individual
